member.name: T:System.Threading.WaitOrTimerCallback
member.summary: Represents a method to be called when a is signaled or times out.
member.param: An object containing information to be used by the callback method each time it executes.
if the timed out; if it was signaled.

member.name: T:System.Threading.ThreadPool
member.summary: Provides a pool of threads that can be used to execute tasks, post work items, process asynchronous I/O, wait on behalf of other threads, and process timers.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.BindHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Binds an operating system handle to the .
member.param: An that holds the handle. The handle must have been opened for overlapped I/O on the unmanaged side.
member.returns: if the handle is bound; otherwise, .
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.BindHandle(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle)
member.summary: Binds an operating system handle to the .
member.param: A that holds the operating system handle. The handle must have been opened for overlapped I/O on the unmanaged side.
member.returns: if the handle is bound; otherwise, .
member.exception: osHandle is .

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the difference between the maximum number of thread pool threads returned by the method, and the number currently active.
member.param: The number of available worker threads.
The number of available asynchronous I/O threads.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetMaxThreads(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the number of requests to the thread pool that can be active concurrently. All requests above that number remain queued until thread pool threads become available.
member.param: The maximum number of worker threads in the thread pool.
The maximum number of asynchronous I/O threads in the thread pool.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetMinThreads(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the minimum number of threads the thread pool creates on demand, as new requests are made, before switching to an algorithm for managing thread creation and destruction.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the minimum number of worker threads that the thread pool creates on demand.
When this method returns, contains the minimum number of asynchronous I/O threads that the thread pool creates on demand.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(System.Threading.WaitCallback)
member.summary: Queues a method for execution. The method executes when a thread pool thread becomes available.
member.param: A that represents the method to be executed.
member.returns: if the method is successfully queued; is thrown if the work item could not be queued.
member.exception: callBack is .
The common language runtime (CLR) is hosted, and the host does not support this action.

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(System.Threading.WaitCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Queues a method for execution, and specifies an object containing data to be used by the method. The method executes when a thread pool thread becomes available.
member.param: A representing the method to execute.
An object containing data to be used by the method.
member.returns: if the method is successfully queued; is thrown if the work item could not be queued.
member.exception: The common language runtime (CLR) is hosted, and the host does not support this action.
callBack is .

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.RegisterWaitForSingleObject(System.Threading.WaitHandle,System.Threading.WaitOrTimerCallback,System.Object,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a delegate to wait for a , specifying a 32-bit unsigned integer for the time-out in milliseconds.
member.param: The to register. Use a other than .
The delegate to call when the waitObject parameter is signaled.
The object passed to the delegate.

The time-out in milliseconds. If the millisecondsTimeOutInterval parameter is 0 (zero), the function tests the object's state and returns immediately. If millisecondsTimeOutInterval is -1, the function's time-out interval never elapses.

to indicate that the thread will no longer wait on the waitObject parameter after the delegate has been called; to indicate that the timer is reset every time the wait operation completes until the wait is unregistered.
member.returns: The that can be used to cancel the registered wait operation.
member.exception: The millisecondsTimeOutInterval parameter is less than -1.

member.param: The to register. Use a other than .
The delegate to call when the waitObject parameter is signaled.
The object passed to the delegate.
The time-out represented by a . If timeout is 0 (zero), the function tests the object's state and returns immediately. If timeout is -1, the function's time-out interval never elapses.

to indicate that the thread will no longer wait on the waitObject parameter after the delegate has been called; to indicate that the timer is reset every time the wait operation completes until the wait is unregistered.
member.returns: The that encapsulates the native handle.
member.exception: The timeout parameter is less than -1.
The timeout parameter is greater than .

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.SetMaxThreads(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of requests to the thread pool that can be active concurrently. All requests above that number remain queued until thread pool threads become available.
member.param: The maximum number of worker threads in the thread pool.
The maximum number of asynchronous I/O threads in the thread pool.
member.returns: if the change is successful; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.SetMinThreads(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the minimum number of threads the thread pool creates on demand, as new requests are made, before switching to an algorithm for managing thread creation and destruction.
member.param: The minimum number of worker threads that the thread pool creates on demand.
The minimum number of asynchronous I/O threads that the thread pool creates on demand.
member.returns: if the change is successful; otherwise, .

member.returns: if the operation was successfully queued to an I/O completion port; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.UnsafeQueueUserWorkItem(System.Threading.WaitCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Queues the specified delegate to the thread pool, but does not propagate the calling stack to the worker thread.
member.param: A that represents the delegate to invoke when a thread in the thread pool picks up the work item.
The object that is passed to the delegate when serviced from the thread pool.
member.returns: if the method succeeds; is thrown if the work item could not be queued.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.
An out-of-memory condition was encountered.
The work item could not be queued.
callBack is .

member.name: M:System.Threading.ThreadPool.UnsafeRegisterWaitForSingleObject(System.Threading.WaitHandle,System.Threading.WaitOrTimerCallback,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a delegate to wait for a , using a 32-bit signed integer for the time-out in milliseconds. This method does not propagate the calling stack to the worker thread.
member.param: The to register. Use a other than .
The delegate to call when the waitObject parameter is signaled.
The object that is passed to the delegate.

The time-out in milliseconds. If the millisecondsTimeOutInterval parameter is 0 (zero), the function tests the object's state and returns immediately. If millisecondsTimeOutInterval is -1, the function's time-out interval never elapses.

to indicate that the thread will no longer wait on the waitObject parameter after the delegate has been called; to indicate that the timer is reset every time the wait operation completes until the wait is unregistered.
member.returns: The object that can be used to cancel the registered wait operation.
member.exception: The millisecondsTimeOutInterval parameter is less than -1.
The caller does not have the required permission.
